SENT.plain: Whether patients with BehÃ§et's disease (BD) and immunosuppressive therapy are generally prone to acquire severe infectious diseases is unknown
A 48-year-old man under corticosteroids and azathioprine for BD since 1995 was admitted because of a transitory ischemic attack
Between the third and fourth hospital day he was accidentally locked up, insufficiently dressed, in the hospital's chapel over night
On the following day, he developed fever and deteriorating consciousness until he became comatose
CT scans of the brain were normal and there was only a slight pleocytosis
Despite adequate therapy, the patient's condition further deteriorated such that he died

Responsible for his decline was a fulminate sepsis, diagnosed upon fever, increased C-reactive protein, thrombocyte decline, multi-organ failure, rhabdomyolysis, growth of S. aureus on blood culture, and autopsy
Patients with BD and immunosuppressive therapy, may be more vulnerable to infections and may develop lethal overwhelming sepsis already after overnight cold exposure
